METASCHEMA.schema-name: OSCAL Shared Responsibility Format -- Common Modules

remarks.p: This contains all modules common to shared responsibility in the ssp and component definition models.

define-assembly.name: source-ssp
define-assembly.description: This has not been described in the prototype.

define-flag.name: ssp-uuid
define-flag.description: This has not been described in the prototype.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: This has not been described in the prototype.

define-field.name: published
define-field.description: This has not been described in the prototype.

define-field.name: last-modified
define-field.description: This has not been described in the prototype.

define-field.name: version
define-field.description: This has not been described in the prototype.

define-assembly.name: referenced-profile
define-assembly.description: This has not been described in the prototype.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: A link to a resource that defines a set of components and/or capabilities to import into this collection.

remarks.p: This value may be one of:

ol.li: an absolute URI that points to a network resolvable resource,
a relative reference pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
a bare URI fragment (i.e., `#uuid`) pointing to a back-matter resource in this or an imported document (see linking to another OSCAL object).

define-assembly.name: provided
define-assembly.description: Describes a capability which may be inherited by a leveraging system.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this provided entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the provided entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be provided to another system leveraging this system.

remarks.p: Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: responsibility
define-assembly.description: Describes a control implementation responsibility imposed on a leveraging system.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this responsibility elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the responsibility can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system must implement to satisfy the control provided by a leveraged system.

remarks.p: A role defined at the by-component level takes precedence over the same role defined on the parent implemented-requirement or on the referenced component.
Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: inherited
define-assembly.description: Describes a control implementation inherited by a leveraging system.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this inherited entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the inherited control implementation can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

remarks.p: Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: satisfied
define-assembly.description: Describes how this system satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this satisfied control implementation entry elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the control implementation can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is implementing based on a requirement from a leveraged system.

remarks.p: Since responsible-role associates multiple party-uuid entries with a single role-id, each role-id must be referenced only once.

define-assembly.name: export
define-assembly.description: Identifies content intended for external consumption, such as with leveraged organizations, customer responsibility documentation, and shared security responsibility documentation.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be available to another system leveraging this system.

define-flag.name: provided-uuid
define-flag.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to an inherited control implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

define-flag.name: satisfied-uuid
define-flag.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a satisfied control implementation.

define-flag.name: responsibility-uuid
define-flag.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a control implementation that satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.
